@HeerJeet Kipling's actually interested in how power works socially. Has much more interesting things to say abt race

@HeerJeet But racism not grounded in reality. So it's not going to be jarring to folks who are racist, pretty much ever.
@hoodedu No, but point isn't even exaggerating racism, it's reviving older accepted norm in new context to jarring effect.
@HeerJeet I'm saying using exaggerated racism to parody racism is ineffective, because racism can't be exaggerated.

@HeerJeet in itself critique racism, because just pointing to racism and saying, "that's ridiculous" is ineffectual, bec. racism

@hoodedu I think nostalgia and sexiness of racism are topics worth exploring, either artistically or analytically.
@HeerJeet be less invested in the nostalgia and sexiness of racism than Crumb is.
@hoodedu Point isn't just "this is ridiculous" -- it's: "this is history that now makes us uncomfortable & we don't want to face."
@HeerJeet doesn't have a grounding in reality.
@HeerJeet Also...resurrecting older racism may be "bracing", but to whom?
@HeerJeet I think Bamboozled had a thing or two to say about that.

@HeerJeet just leaves you reproducing racist tropes at higher volume.
